jyVis
Class JyVis

java.lang.Object
  jyVis.JyVis

public class JyVis
extends java.lang.Object

The global access point into JyVis, and a bunch of convenience methods.

Author:
Curran Kelleher

Constructor Detail

JyVis

public JyVis()
Method Detail

promptUserToOpenDataTable

public static void promptUserToOpenDataTable()
Prompts the user to open a CSV data table. When a CSV file is selected and read, it is added to the list of data tables, and set as the currently selected one.

promptUserToSaveSession

public static void promptUserToSaveSession()
Prompts the user to save a session file of the current session.

promptUserToReplaySession

public static void promptUserToReplaySession()
Prompts the user to open and replay a session file.

promptUserToExportSelection

public static void promptUserToExportSelection()
Prompts the user to export the current selection as a csv file

promptUserToExportImageAsPNG

public static void promptUserToExportImageAsPNG()
Prompts the user to export the current selection as a csv file

replaySession

public static void replaySession(java.lang.String sessionFilePath)
Replay the specified session file.

Parameters:
sessionFilePath - the path of the session file to replay.

getSelectedData

public static DataTable getSelectedData()
Gets the currently selected data table. If there is no data table selected, the user is prompted to open one. If the user cancels this operation, then this method returns null.

Returns:
the currently selected data table, or null if there is none.

openDataTable

public static void openDataTable(java.lang.String path)
Opens the specified CSV file as a data table, and sets it as the currently selected one (the one which will be returned from the getSelectedData() method).

Parameters:
path - the path of the CSV file to open

getBaseWindow

public static javax.swing.JFrame getBaseWindow()
Gets the global base window for JyVis, or creates it if it doesn't yet exist. The bounds are set automagically, but setInternalVisible() must be called to show it

Returns:
the base window

getScreenSize

public static java.awt.Dimension getScreenSize()
If the base desktop does not exist (if getBaseWindow() has never been called), this method returns the size of the actual screen. If the base desktop does exist (if getBaseWindow() has been called), this method returns the size of the base desktop, which contains the visualization windows.

Returns:
the size of the screen, or the size of the baseDesktop if it exists.

getDataTables

public static java.util.List<DataTable> getDataTables()
Gets the list of open data tables

createMenuForScriptDirectory

public static javax.swing.JMenu createMenuForScriptDirectory(java.lang.String directory)
Creates a menu based on the structure of the specified directory. The leaf menu items will execute their corresponding Jython script when clicked.

Parameters:
directory - the path of the directory to build the menu from, which should only contain directories and Jython scripts.
Returns:
the menu generated from the specified directory. The directory tree structure is mirrored by the menu tree structure, and leaf menu items execute their corresponding scripts when clicked.

createMenuForScriptDirectory

public static javax.swing.JMenu createMenuForScriptDirectory(java.io.File directory)
Creates a menu based on the structure of the specified directory. The leaf menu items will execute their corresponding Jython script when clicked. Menus are only created for .py files, so directories with no .py files inside them are not made into menus.

Parameters:
directory - the directory to build the menu from, which should only contain directories and Jython scripts.
Returns:
the menu generated from the specified directory. The directory tree structure is mirrored by the menu tree structure, and leaf menu items execute their corresponding scripts when clicked. Null is retured if the directory contains no .py files

createWindow

public static void createWindow(java.awt.Component panel)
Creates a new window with the specified panel in it. If there is no base desktop, then an external window is returned with default bounds of 500 X 500 centered on the screen. If the base desptop exists (if getBaseWindow() has been called), then an internal frame is created, added to the base desktop, and returned. If the panel is an instance of DrawingPanel, then the new window set up with the appropriate listeners for showing it's property panel in the split pane when the window has focus

updateAllWidgets

public static void updateAllWidgets()
Updates all widgets (JLWidgets) to match their internal state.

resetSystemState

public static void resetSystemState()
Effectively resets the state of the system to be the same as it was before any scripts were executed.

showSystemPropertyPanel

public static void showSystemPropertyPanel()
Displays the system property panel in the split pane.

doRTest

public static void doRTest()
